info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 6:28PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Teller and northwestern El Paso Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 628 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southwestern Colorado Springs, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Colorado Springs around 635 PM MDT. Stratmoor around 640 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Manitou Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
